creator: Brianaala
title: How to do a Forensic Facial Reconstruction
materials_required: Clay or sculpting material for muscles, skin, and cartilage
description: This project outlines the steps involved in a manual 3-D forensic facial reconstruction. It begins with a forensic workup to determine characteristics of the deceased and then details the process of recreating the face on a skull cast using anatomical knowledge and sculpting techniques. The goal is to produce a likeness that can aid in identification.
steps: Perform a forensic workup to determine age, sex, stature, ancestry, and any abnormalities from the skull.
Create a mold of the skull using slow set alginate and cast it in a gypsum material.
Create and position the eyeballs in their anatomically accurate location.
Estimate the shape and angles of the nose based on established guidelines.
Use styrene to form the 'backbone' of the nasal cartilage.
Sculpt the nasal cartilage and place depth markers at osteometric points on the skull, using tissue depth data based on the individual's characteristics.
Sculpt the individual facial muscles, guided by skull morphology and tissue depth markers.
Add the skin layer, including wrinkles and pores, based on anatomical studies and the individual's estimated age, health, and habits.
Add any hair, accessories, or clothing found with the body.
Take photos, often in black and white, to avoid conveying uncertain information like eye or skin color.
